newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania to auction Black Sea free trade zone land. [corrected 17:12 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Romania to auction Black Sea free trade zone land. [corrected 17:12 gmt]

text.p: Romania will auction leases for land and buildings in the free trade zone of the Black Sea port of Constanta in May (Corrects from this week), the operators of the free trade zone said on Tuesday.

The tender, open to Romanian and foreign individuals and corporate customers, is scheduled for May 5 (corrects from March 5) in Constanta, the Administratia Zonei Libere RA Constanta Sud (AZLCS) said in a statement.
The AZLCS, which has a total of 177 hectares (435 acres), is located in the Constanta Sud port, which was built as an extension of the main maritime port of Constanta.
The statement gave no details on the acreage of land or capacity of warehouses to be offered in the March 5 tender.
Under a 1993 law, local and foreign investors are allowed to lease land and buildings within Romania's free trade zones for periods of up to 50 years.
Businesses in the free trade areas are exempt from profit and value added taxes and customs and excise duties for the same period.

Constanta is a strategic gateway into Europe, allowing access through the Danube to the Rhine and Main rivers. It is located at a crossing of major European and Middle Eastern trade routes and near the Russian and Ukrainian markets.
